title: Dutch act of abdication – font or calligraphy?
content:
I was wondering if the act of abdication that was signed in the Netherlands yesterday is handwritten or typeset in a font. Here are some pictures I found:

- [http://www.google.com/hostednews/getty/media/ALeqM5iDOK5lfyRa5mKmxWgw3ED...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/www.google.com/hostednews/getty/media/ALeqM5iDOK5lfyRa5mKmxWgw3EDdYMjlTQ?docId=167786391 "http://www.google.com/hostednews/getty/media/ALeqM5iDOK5lfyRa5mKmxWgw3EDdYMjlTQ?docId=167786391")
- [http://image.gala.de/v1/cms/Gx/thronwechsel-urkunde\_5864477-landscape-li...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/image.gala.de/v1/cms/Gx/thronwechsel-urkunde_5864477-landscape-lightbox.jpg?v=7659203 "http://image.gala.de/v1/cms/Gx/thronwechsel-urkunde\_5864477-landscape-lightbox.jpg?v=7659203")
- [http://www.nrc.nl/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/ANP-23178448.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/www.nrc.nl/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/ANP-23178448.jpg "http://www.nrc.nl/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/ANP-23178448.jpg")

This [font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thomasjockin/ductus/) seems pretty close, but it’s not quite it. I’d be grateful for some expert advice. Thanks in advance!
author: R.

comments.content:
The title font looks like **[Constantia (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=MS-Windows-Fonts&ffam=Constantia%20-%20Bold&fid=52aa0a3cdfe35d06f7b5ee97ab0cb6f3&fsize=36&text=BEATRIX%20%2F%20WILLEM%20-%20ALEXANDER&wrap=2)** by John Hudson (Ascender Corp, 2005) delivered with Microsoft Windows but I will be really surprised if they used a standard Windows font in this document.

The text-body looks close to **[Fondamento](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419015954/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Google-Web-Fonts&ffam=Fondamento%20-%20Regular&fid=bc5bd19e57c28417fe4e8a88c345073c&fsize=60&text=Prins%20van%20Oranje%2C%20overeenkomstig&wrap=2)** by Brian J. Bonislawsky (part of Google-Web-Fonts, 2011) but it's probably still not a perfect match

Thanks! I’d be surprised, too, if they used a ClearType font and a free font they got from Google Fonts for this document. If anybody can shed more light on the printing/writing process, that’d be welcome.

_Constantia (Bold) by John Hudson (Ascender Corp, 2005)_

Actually Tiro Typeworks, 2004. Ascender (now Monotype) license the fonts from Microsoft.

Very interesting, that answers my question. Thanks!

PS: If anyone can find a less blurry picture online, I’d be grateful for the link.
